questions.question_text: Which type of information should be captured during the first customer engagement?

discussion.content: C is correct
C Correct

choices.C: It is the business methodology of ensuring that customers are always on the latest software releases and subscription contracts so that they can focus on the core business activities that make them successful.
choices.D: It is a measure of the Net Promoter Score that results from a disciplined engagement of sales, services, marketing, and customer success teams working seamlessly to deliver a positive experience for the customer.
choices.A: It is the business methodology of ensuring that customers achieve their expected and unexpected outcomes while using your product or service.
choices.B: It is a business methodology for increasing recurring revenues by minimizing the risk of churn while driving adoption and expansion.

questions.question_text: Which definition of customer success is true?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
success is measured by revenue and reducing churn
A is correct
In Cisco saleconect training, document said that "Our second important transformation is the focus toward recurring revenue". So B maybe correct?

Selected Answer: A
I would go for A. CX is focused on outcomes and value. Regarding the confusing "unexpected", this is from the Blackbelt training: With this tool (Success Plan), the CSM guides the customer to expected, and potentially unexpected, value within the solution. Menitioned many times in the training.
A Correct. The focus of customer success is to enable customer’s business outcomes through the utilization of the CSM’s company’s products and services.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
Customer Success is the business methodology of ensuring customers achieve their desired outcomes while using your product or service.so i agree with B
I believe A is the correct answer.
A is correct

comments.content: Words "unexpected" and "unwanted" have two completely different meanings, so A is correct

discussion.content: but it mentions unwanted outcomes as well..So I doubt if it can be considered as the correct answer

A is correct: https://www.gainsight.com/guides/the-essential-guide-to-customer-success/

"Customer Success is the business methodology of ensuring customers achieve their desired outcomes while using your product or service."

Selected Answer: D
Correct

questions.question_text: Which definition of a use case is true?

discussion.content: C Correct.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. What does this health score indicate?

choices.B: The customer is unlikely to advocate for this product.
choices.D: The customer needs to purchase more licenses.
choices.A: The customer is unlikely to renew this license.
choices.C: The customer needs to consume more of this product.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Health scores are often used to assess the overall health and satisfaction of a customer using a product or service. Based on the provided scores, a utilization score of 46 along with low scores in implement, use, engage, adopt, and optimize categories indicates that the customer might not be deriving significant value from the product or service. This lower overall health score implies potential dissatisfaction and, as a result, the customer might be unlikely to renew the license when it comes up for renewal.
B slightly over A
Why not C; customer needs to use more of this product.

I would slightly prefer B. The customer is using the solution, they are not aware of the advanced features, they do not have "trust and love". They will definitely not advocate the solution, maybe even renew.

Health Index includes.. Utilization, Quality, CX Sentiment, FIN value
This seems out of scope or from old content.
My choice is A
